meanings.definition: The quality or fact of being greater in number, quantity, or importance.
meanings.sent1: The preponderances of evidence supported the conclusion.
meanings.sent2: The preponderances of votes favored the new policy.
meanings.sent3: The preponderances of cupcakes at the party disappeared in record time.
meanings.sent4: Her preponderances of kindness made her a beloved figure in the community.
meanings.sent5: The preponderances of stars in the night sky took her breath away.

meanings.definition: The greater part or number; a majority.
meanings.sent1: In the debate, the preponderances agreed with the proposed solution.
meanings.sent2: The preponderances of students preferred the early class time.
meanings.sent3: The preponderances of cookies in the jar were gone before dinner.
meanings.sent4: His preponderances of jokes kept the audience laughing all night.
meanings.sent5: The preponderances of flowers in the garden created a beautiful display.
